content: * *Nexif RATCH Energy** is a [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)-based company that owns and operates [wind farms](/wiki/Wind_farm) and other renewable energy projects in several countries. It is a joint venture of Nexif and RATCH Group Thailand PCL founded in December 2022. ## Power sources Nexif power stations SiteCountryLocationTypeGeneration (MW)[Lincoln Gap Wind Farm](/wiki/Lincoln_Gap_Wind_Farm)Australia[Lincoln Gap, South Australia](/wiki/Lincoln_Gap,_South_Australia)Wind farm212[Glen Innes Wind Farm](/wiki/Glen_Innes_Wind_Farm)Australia[Glen Innes, New South Wales](/wiki/Glen_Innes,_New_South_Wales)Wind farm90Ben Tre wind farmVietnam[Thạnh Phú District](/wiki/Th%E1%BA%A1nh_Ph%C3%BA_District), [Ben Tre Province](/wiki/Ben_Tre_Province)Wind farm80Coc San Hydro PowerVietnam[Lào Cai Province](/wiki/L%C3%A0o_Cai_Province)Run of the river hydro30Nexif Energy Rayong (NER)Thailand[Rayong](/wiki/Rayong)[Combined cycle](/wiki/Combined_cycle)110 In August 2019, Nexif took up a 25-year lease of the [Temporary Generation North](/wiki/Temporary_Generation_North) consisting of five [open cycle gas turbines](/wiki/Open_cycle_gas_turbine) in [South Australia](/wiki/South_Australia), with the lease taking effect from May 2020. The generators will be relocated by Nexif to a new site at [Outer Harbor](/wiki/Outer_Harbor,_South_Australia) and converted to operate on natural gas before the end of 2020. Nexif also proposes to convert them to [combined cycle](/wiki/Combined_cycle) with a steam turbine in the following few years.
title: Nexif Energy
